newsitem.title: UK: EDF Man provides focus of new sugar freight inquiry.
newsitem.headline: EDF Man provides focus of new sugar freight inquiry.

text.p: E D & F Man dominated the fresh inquiry on the sugar freight market at the end of the week and issued three new orders, shipbrokers said on Friday.
It quoted for 4,000 tonnes of bagged sugar from the Philippines to Lagos for 7/14 March and 12,000 tonnes from Immingham or Eemshaven to Iran for prompt/14 days.
Man also amended the size of its earlier bulk order from the Philippines to US Gulf/Atlantic to 14/26,000 tonnes from a previous 16,300/16,700 tonnes.
This week's 28 February/4 March account order for 14,000 tonnes of bagged sugar from Dunkirk to Libya was still open, shipbrokers said.
In other news, Iran bought 14,000 tonnes of European Union sugar for April shipment and 30,000 tonnes of Cuban raws for March/May, trade sources said.
Confirmation of the sellers is still awaited but a leading London trade house was believed to be the seller of the whites while two other houses were involved in the raws deal, they added.
